data.title: Om Shanti Om To Welcome: 4 Blockbuster Movies That Ruled The Box
data.meta_description: Welcome, starring Akshay Kumar, became the second highest-grossing film of 2007.
data.text:
The year 2007 was a bit special for Bollywood. The four veteran Bollywood superstars, Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan, Aamir Khan, and Akshay Kumar, gave blockbuster films at the box office.

Let’s have a look at the movies by these stars that shaped the box office scenario in India in 2007-

1. Om Shanti Om

This 2007 film was written and directed by Farah Khan and produced by Gauri Khan under the banner of Red Chillies Entertainment. It featured Shah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone in the main roles and also featured Arjun Rampal, Shreyas Talpade, and Kirron Kher in other pivotal roles. This film proved to be a blockbuster at the box office.

As per reports, the movie was produced on a budget of Rs 40 crore and earned Rs 150 crore worldwide. At the 53rd Filmfare Awards, the film received a leading 13 nominations, including Best Film, Best Director (Farah), Best Actor (Shah Rukh), Best Actress (Padukone), and Best Supporting Actor (Talpade), and won two awards; Best Female Debut (Padukone) and Best Special Effects.

2. Partner:

This Salman Khan film became the third highest-grossing film of the year 2007. The romantic comedy was directed by David Dhawan and produced by Sohail Khan. Along with Salman Khan, Govinda, Lara Dutta, and Katrina Kaif were also seen in lead roles.

3. Welcome

This film by Akshay Kumar became the second highest-grossing film of 2007. It was a comedy film, co-written and directed by Anees Bazmee. The film had an ensemble cast of Anil Kapoor, Nana Patekar, Katrina Kaif, Feroz Khan, Paresh Rawal and Mallika Sherawat. Welcome inspired quite a few sequels over the years with the latest one – Welcome to the Jungle– to be released in 2024.

4. Taare Zameen Par

Aamir Khan’s Taare Zameen Par not just had a great message it fared quite well at the box office too. One of the biggest movies of 2007, it starred Darsheel Safary as a kid suffering from dyslexia. Taare Zameen Par bagged several awards and was India’s official entry at the 81st Academy Awards for Best Foreign Film.
